intro: Peucedanum lativittatum, commonly known as the broad-ribbed angelica, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features tall, hollow stems covered in fine hairs and large, compound leaves with a distinctive, fern-like appearance. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the family. The roots of Peucedanum lativittatum are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
